replies.msg:
I’d say love does exist for sure, at least in a form of mother love there’s no doubt that it’s love. But just have that sort of idea that romantic love is a bit “overrated”, despite how it is driven by sexuality. In my sense, humans most of the time love themselves more than the people they love, they love to feel completed, to feel understood, and try to romanticise that the another one is the right one, but comeon we all know that there’s millions of the “right one” outside the world. But we just prefer to believe in this way.
I’ve gotta say, the only ex that we still love each other is that the one I have never had any romantic relationship with, maybe just a month, but then we moved on and kept being just a friend. Two year later we still talk, we still care about each other a lot, maybe we did mention that I love her or she loves me. But we have never thought about getting back together. At least not now. But this kind of unconditional caring thing makes me think that maybe that’s the kind of love I agree with
